data.name: Progressive tax
data.description:
In accordance with Wikipedia a progressive tax is a tax in which the tax rate increases as the taxable amount increases. The task of this kata is to perform a tax calculation dependinging on provided tax rates which can be different.

For example we can take spanish tax rates (2023) which are as follows:

  • from 0 € to 12'449 € tax rate is 19%
  • from 12'450 € to 20'199 € tax rate is 24%
  • from 20'200 € to 35'199 € tax rate is 30%
  • from 35'200 € to 59'999 € tax rate is 37%
  • from 60'000 € to 299'999 € tax rate is 45%
  • from 300'000 € tax rate is 47%
If person had yearly income of 70'000 € then for each part we need to apply different tax rate: 
0 - 12'449      = 12'449 * 19%  =  2'365.31 €
12'450 - 20'199 =  7'750 * 24%  =  1'860.00 €
20'200 - 35'199 = 15'000 * 30%  =  4'500.00 €
35'200 - 59'999 = 24'800 * 37%  =  9'176.00 €
60'000 - 70'000 = 10'001 * 45%  =  4'500.45 €
-----------------------------------------------
                     Total tax  = 22'401.76 €

Have in mind that all numbers are included when calculating the money amount for each part.
Because different countries have different tax rates depending on the year we should be able to calculate tax based on any provided tax rates.
Your function will receive the amount of money a person earned (10'000 - 10'000'000)and tax rates as an array of objects representing each tax-rate. Here is an example of tax rates array: 

const rates = [
  { from: 0, to: 12449, rate: 19 },
  { from: 12450, to: 20199, rate: 24 },
  { from: 20200, to: 35199, rate: 30 },
  { from: 35200, to: 59999, rate: 37 },
  { from: 60000, to: 299999, rate: 45 },
  { from: 300000, rate: 47 },
]

You should return total amount of tax that a person should pay.
After you perform all the calculations round the result to cents (x.5 should be rounded up, less then x.5 should be rounded down) example: 10.545 ==> 10.55, 10.5449 ==> 10.54
All inputs will be valid.

Good luck!
